column4: I know my computer is Acer Aspire, but how can I find out which model is it?
laptop?
http://www.google.com/search?q=tar%20extract%20specific%20file welcome to the internet
i want to extract everything, but i dont want all those folders when i extract, i only want the "files" folder
ah
and it's too much trouble to cd there first?
heh, okay
that'd be -C
no you are
when i run tar -czf files.tar.gz ~/Documents/files, the tar contains all those folders /home/user/Documents/files, but i simply want the tarbaøø to contain the folder "files"
yes I understood you eventually, you want -C
tar -czf files.tar.gz files -C ~/Documents
see last
-C is not what im looking for. i want tar -czf lal.tar.gz files to NOT include the whole folder hierarchy
well then you need a shell script and an alias, have fun
perhaps you could use 7z instead, it supports the same formats, AIUI

but i have seen other tarballs which does not contain the home folder neither the user folder. they simply contain the folder which was tarballed. how can i do this? each time i tar something, my /home and my user folder, and all other directories leading to the folder i want to tar
I already told you

are you sure you understand what i am trying to do? it seems to me, that you think, that i want to extract parts of a tarball. i only want to create a tarball containg onlt the folder which i tarballed, not a tarball containg home/user/folder_to_be_tarballed
that was somsip not me
I already told you how to get what you want, in various ways
after rereading your chat, i finally understood how it worked. thank you
:D
